snippet: Jim Fox, a leader of a Long Island league and of the Amateur Athletic Union in the New York area, is helping to have patches displayed on thousands of young people’s uniforms.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column describes evolution of Wear Orange campaign, which began in New York City in October 2015 when players in New Renaissance Basketball Assn starting wearing orange patches on jerseys to raise awareness about gun violence; notes effort has expanded to about 300 amateur basketball teams across country.
lead_paragraph: Jim Fox, a leader of a Long Island league and of the Amateur Athletic Union in the New York area, is helping to have patches displayed on thousands of young people’s uniforms.

headline.print_headline: Children at Play Can Convey Sober Message
headline.main: Wear Orange Campaign Enlists Youth Basketball Players to Spread Message on Gun Violence
